new_organization_name: National Institute of Standards and Technology

The United States Trade Representative (USTR) is the principal trade advisor, negotiator, and spokesperson on U.S. trade issues. They manage trade negotiations, enforce trade agreements, and develop trade policies that align with national interests.

The U.S. Commission on Civil Rights is a federal agency established to inform the development of national civil rights policy and laws through research, analysis, and recommendations. The Commission conducts hearings, issues reports, and provides a platform for public input on civil rights issues.

The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) is a federal executive department responsible for developing and executing federal government policy on farming, agriculture, forestry, and food.
